title: Russia talks a big future in space while its overall budget is quietly cut
summary: The presentation had something of the feel of a Potemkin Village.

title: China to send new modules and co-orbiting spacecraft to Tiangong space station
summary: China will send new modules to its Tiangong space station in coming years to expand the outpost’s volume and capabilities.

title: U.S. Space Force awards Booz Allen $630 million contract for satellite systems support
summary: Booz Allen Hamilton won a seven-year, $630 million contract from the U.S. Space Force for systems engineering and integration of satellite systems

title: Comtech wins $48 million U.S. Army contract for satellite modems
summary: he U.S. Army awarded Comtech Telecommunications a $48.6 million contract to develop a satellite modem that can connect to multiple networks

title: Axiom Space partners with Prada on Artemis spacesuits
summary: Axiom Space has selected an unconventional partner to assist in its development of spacesuits that will be worn by the next NASA astronauts to walk on the moon: Prada.

title: First Intuitive Machines lunar lander ready for launch
summary: Intuitive Machines’ first lunar lander is complete and ready to ship for a launch next month as executives say they’re cautiously optimistic about the prospects of a successful landing.

title: McCarthy Ousted as Speaker of the House
summary: A small group of ultra-conservative House Republicans ousted Kevin McCarthy as their party leader today. Eight House Freedom Caucus members joined all Democrats in voting in favor of a motion […]

title: Ars takes a close-up look at the first US lunar lander in half a century
summary: "Our strategy is being there and being ready to go."

title: Japan conducting studies for reusable next-gen rocket
summary: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency is working on plans for a new, large and reusable launch vehicle as the core of its future space transportation plans.

title: Military space groups in New Mexico expand recruitment and STEM
summary: Military space organizations in New Mexico are funding science, technology, engineering and math education, expanding internship programs and bolstering local and long-distance recruitment efforts.
